Master Answer:
In the routine BC immunization schedule for infants and children, the Hepatitis A vaccine is publicly funded (free) for all Aboriginal children and adolescents aged 6 months to 18 years.  Health units provide free vaccines, find a location near you here. Other indications for the free vaccine are listed here.
If your child is not eligible for the free vaccine, Hepatitis A vaccine can be purchased and received from a travel health clinic or most pharmacies (5 years of age and older). Services vary across BC.
Immunization Nurse
